intro: Mariscus preissii, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a compact growth habit and is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from underground sources. Mariscus preissii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
